title: Seat - Removal

body.body: Warning - General - Stabilise Motorcycle - including DO NOT support on non integral parts
Make sure the motorcycle is stabilised and adequately supported.
Do not support the motorcycle on any ancillary component, the exhaust system or any other non structural parts of the motorcycle frame.
A correctly supported motorcycle will help prevent it from falling.
An unstable motorcycle may fall resulting in motorcycle damage, serious injury or death.
To prevent damage to the seats or seat covers, care must be taken not to drop the seats.

Do not lean the seats against the motorcycle or any surface which may damage the seats or seat covers. Instead, place the seats, with the seat cover facing upwards, on a clean, flat surface which is covered with a soft cloth.
Do not place any item on the seats which may cause damage or staining to the seat covers.
Seat removal DV; DVB; DVX; DX4; DVB
Remove the front fixing from the seat assembly.
Remove the two side fixings and remove the seat assembly from the frame. Collect the flanged sleeve from the frame.
Release the lock nuts and washers and remove the seat assembly from the seat mount.
Release the seven fixings and remove the seat from the seat mounting plate. Retain the badge for installation.
Note the position of the captive nuts on the seat for installation. Remove the captive nuts from the seat.
